In this session we will be discussing from the second verse of the seventeenth chapter of the first canto of Sriman Bhagavatam.
Vrisham Vrindala Dhavalam Mehantam Iva Bhyatam Vepamanam Padaikenam Siddhantam Shudra Taditam
The meaning of this verse is, the bull was as white as a white lotus flower.
He was terrified of the Shudra.
Who was beating him and he was so afraid that he was standing on one leg trembling and urinating.
So further descriptions of the age of Kali is being given here by Suta Goswami, Srila Suta Goswami.
The bull is actually the personality of religious principles, Dharma.
In the shape, in the formality.
In the form of a bull, the personality of religious principles has appeared in order to give us a message.
Now Srila Prabhupada explains what is the significance of this bull being described as as white as a white lotus flower.
The purpose Srila Prabhupada says, the next symptom of the age of Kali is that principles of religion which are all spotlessly white.
Like the white lotus flower will be attacked by the uncultured Shudra population of the age.
In the scriptures it is said, Kalau Shudra Sambhavaha, in Kali Yuga majority of the population will be of the Shudra category.
Shudra category means uncultured, uncultured.
They don't follow the cultural principles.
They don't have a system for purification of the contamination due to this age.
Just like to beget a child according to scriptural directions or injunctions.
